Key Match Events: Bukayo Saka had a goal disallowed in a stale first half
A deep cross from the left is headed back into the England box, where Sesko has a free header, but there is little pace on the ball and Pickford saves quite comfortably.
Foden strikes a free kick well, arrowing towards the top corner, but Oblak saves without having to dive.
A good chance for England late on as Kane unselfishly flicks the ball on to Palmer, cutting in from the right and unmarked, but his low shot is too close to Oblak.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate will be under more scrutiny given that England have scored just two goals in three group games thus far.
For Slovenia, it was delight as they secured their passage to the last 16.
England's last-16 opponents are yet to be confirmed, with the Netherlands a possibility.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate will be under more scrutiny given that England have scored just two goals in three group games thus far.
Phil Foden's movement was by some margin the most incisive of England's forward players.
Kobbie Mainoo was busier than Gallagher, gave England a semblance of a spark and may well have played his way into the starting line-up for England's last-16 tie.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England topped Group C at Euro 2024 after a goalless draw with Slovenia which will do little to quell the question marks shrouding Gareth Southgate's team.
Slovenia dug in for that draw towards the end, rather than pushing for what would have been a first-ever win at a European Championship, making England's task even harder.
Others: Harry Kane of England reacts during the UEFA EURO 2024 group stage match between England and Slovenia at Cologne Stadium on June 25, 2024 in Cologne, Germany.
